dt: {bc}to hinder or prevent the passage of
{bc}to get in the way of {bc}be wounded or killed by

dt.t: easy to {wi}stop{/wi} a bullet along a lonely … road

dt: {bc}to close up or block off (an opening) {bc}{sx|plug||}
{bc}to cover over or fill in (a hole or crevice)
{bc}to cause to give up or change a course of action
{bc}to keep from carrying out a proposed action {bc}{sx|restrain||}, {sx|prevent||}
{bc}to instruct one's bank to refuse (payment) or refuse payment of (something, such as a check)
{bc}to arrest the progress or motion of {bc}cause to halt
{bc}to check by means of a weapon {bc}{sx|bring down||}, {sx|kill||}
{bc}to beat in a boxing match by a knockout
{bc}to change the pitch of (something, such as a violin string) by pressing with the finger
{bc}to change the pitch of (a wind instrument) by closing one or more finger holes or by thrusting the hand or a mute into the bell
{bc}to hold an honor card and enough protecting cards to be able to block (a bridge suit) before an opponent can run many tricks
{bc}to come to an end especially suddenly {bc}{sx|close||}, {sx|finish||}

dt.t: The talking {wi}stopped{/wi} when she entered the room.

pt: {sc}stop{/sc} {sc}cease{/sc} {sc}quit{/sc} {sc}discontinue{/sc} {sc}desist{/sc} mean to suspend or cause to suspend activity. {sc}stop{/sc} applies to action or progress or to what is operating or progressing and may imply suddenness or definiteness.
{sc}cease{/sc} applies to states, conditions, or existence and may add a suggestion of gradualness and a degree of finality.
{sc}quit{/sc} may stress either finality or abruptness in stopping or ceasing.

pt.t: the engine faltered, sputtered, then {it}quit{/it} altogether

pt: {sc}discontinue{/sc} applies to the stopping of an accustomed activity or practice.

pt.t: we have {it}discontinued{/it} the manufacture of that item

pt: {sc}desist{/sc} implies forbearance or restraint as a motive for stopping or ceasing.

pt.t: {it}desisted{/it} from further efforts to persuade them

et: Middle English {it}stoppen{/it}, from Old English {it}-stoppian{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*stuppare{/it} to stop with tow, from Latin {it}stuppa{/it} tow, from Greek {it}styppē{/it}
shortdef: to close by filling or obstructing
to hinder or prevent the passage of
to get in the way of : be wounded or killed by

dt: {bc}a pause or breaking off in speech
{bc}a graduated set of organ pipes of similar design and tone quality
{bc}a corresponding set of vibrators or reeds of a reed organ
often used figuratively in phrases like {it}pull out all the stops{/it} to suggest holding nothing back
{bc}a means of regulating the pitch of a musical instrument
{bc}something that impedes, obstructs, or brings to a halt {bc}{sx|impediment||}, {sx|obstacle||}
{bc}a marking of a series (as of f-numbers) on a camera for indicating settings of the diaphragm
{bc}a device for arresting or limiting motion
used in telegrams and cables to indicate a period
{bc}a pause or break in a verse that marks the end of a grammatical unit
{bc}an order stopping payment (as of a check or note) by a bank
{bc}a consonant characterized by complete closure of the breath passage in the course of articulation {dx}compare {dxt|continuant||}{/dx}
{bc}a depression in the face of an animal at the junction of forehead and muzzle
{bc}a function of an electronic device that {a_link|stops} a recording

shortdef: a pause or breaking off in speech
a graduated set of organ pipes of similar design and tone quality

dt: {bc}to do everything possible in order to do or achieve something

dt.t: The company {it}pulled out all the stops{/it} to advertise their new product.
When he throws a party, he really {it}pulls out all the stops{/it}.

shortdef: to do everything possible in order to do or achieve something

stems: the buck stops here with me

dt: used to say that one accepts a responsibility and will not try to give it to someone else

dt.t: I'm willing to accept the blame for what happened. {phrase}The buck stops here with me{/phrase}.

shortdef: —used to say that one accepts a responsibility and will not try to give it to someone else

dt: {bc}a turnable control device (as for a camera diaphragm opening) that engages with a definite click at specific settings

shortdef: a turnable control device (as for a camera diaphragm opening) that engages with a definite click at specific settings

dt: {bc}to produce two or more tones simultaneously on (an instrument, such as a violin)

shortdef: to produce two or more tones simultaneously on (an instrument, such as a violin)

dt: {bc}material used to close open parts especially of a building for preventing the spread of fire

shortdef: material used to close open parts especially of a building for preventing the spread of fire

dt: {bc}a point at which a vehicle in public transportation stops only on prearrangement or signal

shortdef: a point at which a vehicle in public transportation stops only on prearrangement or signal

dt: {bc}an organ stop made up of flue pipes

shortdef: an organ stop made up of flue pipes

dt: {bc}a camera lens aperture setting indicated by an f-number

shortdef: a camera lens aperture setting indicated by an f-number
